page.title: 08THE E.C.M.R.W.F. CENTRE
page.content: In 1967 17 European countries launched a project to build a meteorological station that would be able to forecast the weather for the world for periods of up to 10 days ahead. The European Centre for Medium Range Weather Forecasting was built at Shinfield Park near Reading partly because of its accessability to London's Heathrow airport and partly because of its proximity to an existing major meteorological and telecommunication centre at Bracknell belonging to the Meteorological Office. It is staffed by experienced meteorologists from the 17 European countries.It makes use of a massive computer connected to thousands of meteorological sensors distributed all over the world to provide the necessary technical data.
